raw_text:
Cole faces lengthy injury lay-off
 
 Aston Villa's Carlton Cole could be out for six weeks with a knee injury.
 
 The striker, who is on a season-long loan from Chelsea, picked up the knock in an England Under-21 match against Holland earlier this month. "Carlton will be out of action for four to six weeks after a bad challenge," said Villa boss David O'Leary. "I won't be able to tell you whether he will need an operation until maybe next week. Whether he has an operation has got to be left to Chelsea." Cole, who also struggled with an ankle problem earlier in the season, was unable to rest because O'Leary had a shortage of strikers. The return to fitness of Darius Vassell after four months out with a broken ankle and the emergence of Luke Moore has alleviated some of the Villa's manager's problems in that department.
llama3.2:1b: Carlton Cole will be out for 4-6 weeks due to a knee injury picked up during an England Under-21 match, and may require surgery.
llama3.2:3b: Carlton Cole may be out for 4-6 weeks due to a knee injury, sustained in an England Under-21 match against Holland.
gemma2:2b: Carlton Cole is out for 4-6 weeks with a knee injury, picked up while playing for England Under-21.
His club, Aston Villa, will decide whether surgery is needed next week after consulting Chelsea.
Cole has missed games due to the injury and was already dealing with an ankle problem.
New additions to the squad have helped alleviate some of the striker shortage at Villa.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Cole is on a long lay-off, while Carlton Cole from Chelsea could miss six weeks after sustaining a knee injury against Holland.
The injured player will need an operation before being released.
Vassell and Moore are contributing to the team without Cole.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Carlton Cole is expected to be out for six weeks due to a knee injury sustained during an England Under-21 match.
His return to fitness could take up to four weeks, with a possible need for surgery not determined yet.
This setback will impact Aston Villa's striker position as it disrupts their recruitment strategy and intensifies competition among other strikers like Darius Vassell and Luke Moore.
qwen2.5:3b: Cole faces a six-week injury lay-off due to a knee injury sustained in an England Under-21 match against Holland.
The striker, on loan from Chelsea, may require surgery but this will be determined after further assessment.

Cole previously had ankle issues earlier in the season and Aston Villa managed without him because of manager David O'Leary's lack of strikers, particularly with Darius Vassell returning from a four-month injury and Luke Moore emerging as a new option.
opencoder:1.5b:
Cole faces lengthy injury lay-off

Aston Villa's Carlton Cole picked up the knock against England Under-21 match in Holland earlier this month, with "I won't be able to tell you whether he will need an operation until maybe next week."
His injury has not been fully addressed due to O'Leary's short-term needs.
After four months out, Darius Vassell returned with a broken ankle, and the emergence of Luke Moore has alleviated some of the Villa's manager's problems in that department.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Carlton Cole, who was on a season-long loan from Chelsea, has been unable to rest due to a knee injury and picked up his injury against England Under-21 in April.
However, after O'Leary faced issues with players, Darius Vassell returned quickly after a four-month layoff due to an ankle injury, and Luke Moore entered the game.
Despite these challenges, the team's resilience has allowed them to manage their problems effectively.
tinyllama:1.1b: Aston Villa's Carlton Cole faces a lengthy injury lay-off after he sustained a knee injury during an England Under-21 match against Holland.
The striker will be out of action for four to six weeks and may require a procedure if needed.
Meanwhile, O'Leary has a shortage of strikeers due to the absence of Darius Vasseul and Luke Moore, and this has alleviated some of his issues in that department.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Aston Villa are facing a major injury crisis, with key striker Carlton Cole facing a six-week layoff after picking up a knee injury.
Villa boss David O'Leary says he won't know until next week if the striker will need an operation to address his injuries.
He has also been without Darius Vassell for four months recovering from an ankle break, while Luke Moore has just returned after a three-month absence due to a broken foot.
This marks a major setback for Aston Villa's attack, which struggled without their star striker earlier in the season before Cole's injury.
phi:2.7b: Carlton Cole may be out for six weeks due to a knee injury sustained during an Under-21 match against Holland.
His loan from Chelsea could be affected, but Chelsea's decision on whether he requires an operation is uncertain until next week.
O'Leary has struggled with the Villa's striker shortage due to Cole's ankle injury and Moore's return to fitness.
orca-mini:3b: Aston Villa's Carlton Cole is expected to miss up to six weeks after sustaining a knee injury in an England Under-21 match against Holland.
hermes3:3b: Carlton Cole (Aston Villa striker) potentially 6-weeks out due to knee injury.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Aston Villa's striker Carlton Cole faces a six-week injury layoff due to a knee injury sustained during an England Under-21 match against Holland.
The duration of the injury and whether it requires surgery will be determined by Chelsea next week.
Despite prior ankle problems, Cole's absence creates issues for Aston Villa as they manage their striker positions, though the return of Darius Vassell and emergence of Luke Moore offer some relief.
chatgpt-4o-latest: Aston Villa striker Carlton Cole could be sidelined for up to six weeks due to a knee injury sustained in an England Under-21 match.
On loan from Chelsea, Cole's need for surgery is yet to be determined.
He previously struggled with an ankle issue but had to play due to a shortage of strikers.
However, the return of Darius Vassell and the rise of Luke Moore have eased Villa's attacking concerns.
stablelm2:1.6b: Striker Carlton Cole, on a season-long loan from Chelsea, may be sidelined for 6 weeks due to a knee injury suffered during an England Under-23 match against Holland earlier this month.
Aston Villa's David O'Leary disclosed that Cole would not know if he needs surgery until possibly next week.

This information was conveyed amidst the club's shortage of strikers and following the return of Darius Vassell after four months out with a broken ankle, as well as Luke Moore's emergence in the position.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Aston Villa striker Carlton Cole, on loan from Chelsea, is expected to be sidelined for four to six weeks due to a severe knee injury sustained during an England Under-21 match against Holland.
Villa manager David O'Leary confirmed the extent of the injury but deferred any decision on potential surgery to Chelsea.
Cole previously dealt with an ankle issue, which further strained Villa's forward options due to the team's shortage of strikers.
The recent recoveries of Darius Vassell and Luke Moore have somewhat mitigated this issue for O'Leary.
